Title: Fungal symbioses in hornworts: a chequered history
Journal: Proceeding of the Royal Society, Biological Sciences
Keywords:
plants, fungi, arbuscular mycorrhizas, evolution,
Endogone, symbiosis
Abstract:
The hornworts are considered the sister group to vascular
plants, but their fungal associations remain largely unexplored. The
ancestral symbiotic condition for all plants is, nonetheless, widely
assumed to be arbuscular mycorrhizal with Glomeromycota fungi. Due to a
recent report of other fungi in some non-vascular plants, here we
investigate the fungi associated with diverse hornworts using electron
microscopy and molecular phylogenetics. We found that both Glomeromycota
and Mucoromycotina fungi can form symbioses with most hornworts
worldwide, often simultaneously. This discovery indicates that ancient
terrestrial plants relied on a wider and more versatile symbiotic
repertoire than previously thought and it highlights the so far
unappreciated ecological and evolutionary role of Mucoromycotina
fungi.
